that's not the reason
the CD boots while the drive is under the control of the BIOS. Then the kernel tries to take over, which is when it fails for some reason.
this happens sometimes when a CD-ROM is of the more recent SATA type, and is connected to a controller that doesn't have support. Hence my earlier question.
since you've installed ubuntu before, that isn't the problem now.
